meanings.sent1: The maculated cat had black spots on its fur.
meanings.sent2: The old book had maculated pages from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The maculated puppy looked adorable with its unique markings.
meanings.sent4: Her maculated dress resembled a piece of modern art.
meanings.sent5: The maculated butterfly fluttered gracefully in the garden.

meanings.definition: To mark with spots or stains
meanings.sent1: She accidentally maculated her shirt with ink.
meanings.sent2: The mud from the garden maculated the clean floor.
meanings.sent3: He maculated the white wall while trying to paint it.
meanings.sent4: The rain maculated the freshly washed car with dirt.
meanings.sent5: The spilled coffee maculated the tablecloth beyond repair.
